result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tou Y Xiong

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: re: sentence credit
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:20 am 
INCLUDES 15CF1110, 15CM1981, AND 16CF260. 
State appears by ADA Matt Adrian; Def appears in person with Atty Jim Kurszewski.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF1110: Ct. 1 (Theft)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM1981: Ct. 2 (DC/DA)>>D&RI. 
In 16CF260: Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Computer Message - Threaten Injury or Harm/DA)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 7 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CM1981: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 16CF260: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS ON ALL: SAFE assessment and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; pay $4600 restitution to Tremors Bar to be paid at a rate of at least $130 per month; no contact with Tremors Bar and H.L. unless authorized by agent; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 1 DA surcharge. 

COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit - parties may submit written stipulation re: jail credit at a later date. 

Adj: 9:40 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

No contact with victim(s): Tremmers Bar. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents. No gambling facilities.
